com.percussion.extensions.i18n
Class PSLocalizeDate

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.extension.PSSimpleJavaUdfExtension
      com.percussion.extensions.i18n.PSLocalizeDate
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSExtension, IPSUdfProcessor
public class PSLocalizeDate
extends PSSimpleJavaUdfExtension

This UDF converts a a given date object to given format and locale. The first parameter is the date to format. This can be a java.util.Date object or a date string. If it is null or empty, current date is assumed. Second parameter is the required output date pattern. Third parameter is the output locale. If null or empty, locale is taken from the user context information. The return value is the formatted date string. Never null.

See Also:
PSI18nUtils.formatDate(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String), PSI18nUtils.getLocaleFromString(java.lang.String), Date

processUdf

public Object processUdf(Object[] params,
                         IPSRequestContext request)

Description copied from interface: IPSUdfProcessor
Executes the UDF with the specified parameters and request context.

Parameters:
params - The parameter values supplied with the request in the appropriate order, as specified by the runtime parameter definitions returned by IPSExtensionDef associated with this UDF.
request - The current request context.
Throws:
PSConversionException - If an error occurred during data conversion. This exception takes two parameters, a message code and an argument. You should always pass in zero (0) for the message code.
